Journal.Title: Journal of chemical information and modeling

Article.ArticleTitle: Chemical Space and Diversity of the NuBBE Database: A Chemoinformatic Characterization.

AbstractText: NuBBE<sub>DB</sub> is the first library of natural products of Brazilian biodiversity. It includes a large variety of classes of compounds and structural types of secondary metabolites of plants, fungi, insects, marine organisms, and bacteria. So far the chemical diversity and complexity of NuBBE<sub>DB</sub> have not been characterized in a systematic and detailed manner. Herein, we report a comprehensive chemoinformatic analysis of the most current version of NuBBE<sub>DB</sub>. As part of the characterization, NuBBE<sub>DB</sub> was compared with several databases of natural products in terms of structural diversity and complexity. Results of the analysis showed that NuBBE<sub>DB</sub> is diverse in terms of structural fingerprints, distribution of chemical scaffolds, and molecular properties. In addition, the results of the visualization of chemical space support quantitatively that NUBBE<sub>DB</sub> is a promising source of molecules for drug discovery and medicinal chemistry.
